metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0646 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In sqlite3_str_vappendf of sqlite3.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege if the user can also inject a printf into a privileged process's SQL with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android-9 Android-10 Android-11 Android-8.1Android ID: A-153352319

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this is an android-specific CVE which corresponds to CVE-2020-13434 in sqlite3

criterions.comment: sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
sqlite3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
